commit_message:
Fix the nit on how to deploy keystone with `mod_proxy_uwsgi`

`mod_proxy_uwsgi` depends on `mod_proxy`, enable `mod_proxy`
only will not enable `mod_proxy_uwsgi`.

Change-Id: Ifad3f6eee09031764aa1817655282e0a423a28a1
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/79/368579/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ``sudo a2enmod proxy``, ``sudo a2enmod proxy_uwsgi``.

commit_message:
[squash] Required backports for stable/newton

Because we branched tripleoclient before other TripleO projects,
some changes in THT broke tripleoclient from stable/newton, and we need
to backport a serie of patches together otherwise they will never pass
CI.

Backport #1:
NTP arg should be optional when specified in an environment
For HA deploy, NTP parameter presence is made mandatory, but it should
be optional if NtpServer parameter has been provided via environment yaml.
Closes-Bug: 1577928
(cherry picked from commit 3ef0a4b889aed3251d7544205973e5ea273079e8)

Backport #2:
Add 'openstack overcloud plan create' command
This uses the new Mistral actions and workflows to create a
plan with the tripleo heat templates. Templates can either
be provided by the user or the default templates on the
undercloud can be used.
Closes-Bug: #1616014
(cherry picked from commit 2c0fecf69ce4889b208b60400eccd935ee32a8d6)

Backport #3:
Update the 'overcloud deploy --templates' command to use Mistral
This is a backwards compatible version of the deploy command
which uses the new Mistral workflows to power the deploy.
Depends-On: I7a61bf6fb71cc4a26aaf4322f2215683aafe20f3
(cherry picked from commit c03ed23272442bf133a47178fba73896fb47c2d0)

Backport #4:
Get template contents from plan, not local path
This allows the new overcloud.j2.yaml format, which is
rendered to create the overcloud.yaml file in the swift
plan via the tripleo.process_templates action
Note it may be valid to modify the roles_data prior to an update,
so we need a plan update workflow that can re-run the process_templates
step.
Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles
(cherry picked from commit 2898e7595f5df5ad9e46a137a8fd5ca6bf166369)

Backport #5:
Update plan files when re-deploying
When doing a second deploy we need to update the plan templates to match those
passed into the deploy command. The cleanest way to do this is to remove the
existing files in swift and then upload the new files.
Closes-Bug: #1620932
(cherry picked from commit 943f5504158980853e636bec2c39879f8644f46e)

Change-Id: I55862204ef71f69bc88c79fe2259f7cb8365699b
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/21/368821/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import hashlibimport os.pathfrom swiftclient.exceptions import ClientExceptionfrom tripleoclient.workflows import deployment from tripleoclient.workflows import parameters as workflow_params from tripleoclient.workflows import plan_management environments, timeout, tht_root): clients = self.app.client_manager workflow_client = clients.workflow_engine self.log.debug("Processing environment files %s" % environments) self.log.debug("Getting template contents from plan %s" % stack_name) # We need to reference the plan here, not the local # tht root, as we need template_object to refer to # the rendered overcloud.yaml, not the tht_root overcloud.j2.yaml # FIXME(shardy) we need to move more of this into mistral actions plan_yaml_path = os.path.relpath(template_path, tht_root) # heatclient template_utils needs a function that can # retrieve objects from a container by name/path objectclient = clients.tripleoclient.object_store def do_object_request(method='GET', object_path=None): obj = objectclient.get_object(stack_name, object_path) return obj and obj[1] template_object=plan_yaml_path, object_request=do_object_request) number_controllers = int(parameters.get('ControllerCount', 0)) if number_controllers > 1: if not env.get('parameter_defaults').get('NtpServer'): raise exceptions.InvalidConfiguration( 'Specify --ntp-server as parameter or NtpServer in ' 'environments when using multiple controllers ' '(with HA).') moved_files = self._upload_missing_files( stack_name, objectclient, files, tht_root) self._process_and_upload_environment( stack_name, objectclient, env, moved_files, tht_root, workflow_client) self._start_mistral_deploy(clients, stack, stack_name) def _start_mistral_deploy(self, clients, stack, plan_name): deployment.deploy(clients, container=plan_name, queue_name=str(uuid.uuid4())) stack_id=plan_name, time.sleep(10) orchestration_client, plan_name, marker, action, verbose_events) def _process_and_upload_environment(self, container_name, swift_client, env, moved_files, tht_root, mistral): """Process the environment and upload to Swift The environment at this point should be the result of the merged custom user environments. We need to look at the paths in the environment and update any that changed when they were uploaded to swift. """ file_prefix = "file://" if 'resource_registry' in env: for name, path in env['resource_registry'].items(): if not isinstance(path, six.string_types): continue if path in moved_files: new_path = moved_files[path] env['resource_registry'][name] = new_path elif path.startswith(file_prefix): path = path[len(file_prefix):] if path.startswith(tht_root): path = path[len(tht_root):] # We want to make sure all the paths are relative. if path.startswith("/"): path = path[1:] env['resource_registry'][name] = path # Parameters are removed from the environment and sent to the update # parameters action, this stores them in the Mistral environment and # means the UI can find them. if 'parameter_defaults' in env: params = env.pop('parameter_defaults') workflow_params.update_parameters( mistral, container=container_name, parameters=params) contents = yaml.safe_dump(env) swift_path = "user-environment.yaml" swift_client.put_object(container_name, swift_path, contents) mistral_env = mistral.environments.get(container_name) user_env = {'path': swift_path} if user_env not in mistral_env.variables['environments']: mistral_env.variables['environments'].append(user_env) mistral.environments.update( name=container_name, variables=mistral_env.variables ) def _upload_missing_files(self, container_name, swift_client, files_dict, tht_root): """Find the files referenced in custom environments and upload them Heat environments can be passed to be included in the deployment, these files can include references to other files anywhere on the local file system. These need to be discovered and uploaded to Swift. When they have been uploaded to Swift the path to them will be different, the new paths are store din the file_relocation dict, which is returned and used by _process_and_upload_environment which will merge the environment and update paths to the relative Swift path. """ file_relocation = {} file_prefix = "file://" for fullpath, contents in files_dict.items(): if not fullpath.startswith(file_prefix): continue path = fullpath[len(file_prefix):] if path.startswith(tht_root): # This should already be uploaded. continue filename = os.path.basename(path) checksum = hashlib.md5() checksum.update(filename) digest = checksum.hexdigest() swift_path = "user-files/{}-{}".format(digest, filename) swift_client.put_object(container_name, swift_path, contents) file_relocation[fullpath] = swift_path return file_relocation workflow_client = clients.workflow_engine plans = plan_management.list_deployment_plans(workflow_client) # TODO(d0ugal): We need to put a more robust strategy in place here to # handle updating plans. if parsed_args.stack in plans: # Upload the new plan templates to swift to replace the existing # templates. plan_management.update_plan_from_templates( clients, parsed_args.stack, tht_root) else: plan_management.create_plan_from_templates( clients, parsed_args.stack, tht_root) parameters, environments, timeout, tht_root) except ClientException as e: messages.append(str(e))
deleted_lines: if number_controllers > 1: if not args.ntp_server: raise exceptions.InvalidConfiguration( 'Specify --ntp-server when using multiple controllers ' '(with HA).') environments, timeout): self.log.debug("Processing environment files") self.log.debug("Getting template contents") template_path) self.log.debug("Deploying stack: %s", stack_name) self.log.debug("Deploying template: %s", template) self.log.debug("Deploying parameters: %s", parameters) self.log.debug("Deploying environment: %s", env) self.log.debug("Deploying files: %s", files) stack_args = { 'stack_name': stack_name, 'template': template, 'environment': env, 'files': files, 'clear_parameters': env['parameter_defaults'].keys(), } if timeout: stack_args['timeout_mins'] = timeout orchestration_client.stacks.create(**stack_args) stack_args['existing'] = 'true' stack_id=stack_name, orchestration_client.stacks.update(stack.id, **stack_args) orchestration_client, stack_name, marker, action, verbose_events) add_registry = False add_registry = True add_registry = True add_registry = True if add_registry: # default resource registry file should be passed only # when creating a new stack, or when custom environments are # specified, otherwise it might overwrite # resource_registries in existing stack resource_registry_path = os.path.join( tht_root, constants.RESOURCE_REGISTRY_NAME) environments.insert(0, resource_registry_path) parameters, environments, timeout) except six.moves.urllib.error.URLError as e: messages.append(str(e.reason))

commit_message:
Spec for performance enhancements for Searchlight indexing.

Change-Id: Ib63ccefa238484c23d20cf79c1aa9e7e50a6e004
implements-blueprint: index-performance-enhancement
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/searchlight-specs refs/changes/79/331879/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode ============================= Index Performance Enhancement ============================= https://blueprints.launchpad.net/searchlight/+spec/index-performance-enhancement. This feature will improve the performance of indexing resource types within Searchlight. Problem Description =================== To provide context, we will review the current design for re-indexing. A re-indexing starts when the admin runs the command: *% searchlight-manage index sync* Under the cover, *searchlight-manage* is doing the following: * Determine which resource groups need to be re-indexed. * Determine which resource types within each resource group needs to be re-indexed. * For each resource type that *does* need to be re-indexed, *searchlight-manage* will call the plugin associated with that resource type. The plugin will make API calls to that service and re-index the information. * For each resource tyrpe that *does not* need to be re-indexed, *searchlight-manage* will call ElasticSearch directly and re-index from the old index into the new index. * Once all re-indexing is complete, the ES aliases are adjusted and *searchlight-manage* returns to the user. This implies the following: * The admin must wait for all of the re-indexing to complete before *searchlight-manage* finishes. * When *searchlight-manage* finishes, the admin knows the exact state of the re-index. Whether it completed successfully or if there was an error. As described in the blueprint, we would like to reduce the time to complete the re-index. Our assumption is that the mainstream case will be for an admin to kick off a re-index and not wanting to wait for it to complete. This is especially noticable when the particular resource type may have a lot of data taking a long time to re-index (e.g. Swift). But we still need to handle the case where the admin wants to know when the re-index completed and if there were any errors. Proposed Change =============== We will use asyncronous threads to implement both enhancements from the blueprint. We need to understand the design issues assoicated with implementing a multi-thread approach. 1. **Are the indexing plugins thread-safe?** If there is a lot of inter-dependencies within the plugins, it may not pay off to try to multi-thread the plugins. Reviewing the code and functionality of the plugins, they appear to be separate enough that they are good candidates to be moved into their own threads. The plugins are isolated from each other and do not depend on any internal structures to handle the actual indexing. 2. **At what level should we create the indexing threads?** The obvious candidates are the resource group type or the resource group. The main reason that we are considering these enhancements is due to the large amount of time for a particular resource type group. But not for a particular resource type within the resource type group. Internal to *searchlight-manage*, this distiction fades rather quickly. We use the resource type groups to only determine which resource types need to be re-indexed. We also have an existing enhancement within *searchlight-manage* where we re-index through the plugin API only the resource types that were explicitly demmanded by the user. All other resource types are re-indexed directly within ElasticSearch. We need to keep this enhancement. Keeping the current design in tact means we will want to thread on the fine resource type level and not at the gross resource type group level. 3. **When will we know to switch the ElasticSearch aliases?** In the serial model of re-indexing, it is trivial to know when to switch the ElasticSearch alias to the use the new index. It's when the last index finishes! Switching over to a model of asyncronous threads running in parallel complicates the alias update. The proposal is that we keep a reference count of active threads. Each thread will decrement the reference count upon completion. When the reference count reaches zero, that thread knows it is the sole survivor of the Searchlight Tontine and collects it's prize. The prize being this remaining thread will update the ElasticSearch aliases before it too expires. We will need an internal Searchlight structure to maintain this state. This structure needs the following attributes: * To be available to all threads. * To be non-volatile so that it can recoverable. * To be able to handle mutliple re-indexing jobs happening simulataneously. The best answer for all of this is to place this internal state within a new index in ElasticSearch. This new index would not be used by any other part of Searchlight. The new index will also be neither available nor visible to any end-users of Searchlight. 4. **How do we restore the missing behavior to *searchlight-manage*?** The end-user visible behaviour of *searchlight-manage* will change for the sake of these enhancements. Now the admin will not know when the re-index task has completed. Nor will the admin know if there was a failure during the re-index. This can be especially troublesome if the failure resulted in the re-indexing being aborted. Since we are assuming this is not the mainstream case, we can handle this in two separate ways. a. We will add a new command line option to remove the threads running asynchornously to *searchlight-manage*. When this option is specified, *searchlight-manage* will still run each resource type in a separate thead. But now *searchlight-manage* will wait for all threads to complete before returning to the user. We will *not* be calling this option "sync", thus preventing the command: *% searchlight-manage index sync sync* b. We will return a job ID when the threads are running asycnhronously. We will add a new command to *searchlight-manage* to return the state of a specified job ID. The internal state will be stored in ElasticSearch in the new index as described in design issue #3 (above). Possible states would be: * "Success" : All asynronous threads have completed successfully. * "Failure" : A catastrophic error occured within a thread and the re-indexing stopped. The error would be returned to the user. * "Running Clean" : At least one asynchronous thread is still busy re-indexing and all previous threads completey successfully. * "Running Dirty" : At least one asynchronous thread is still busy re-indexing and one or more previous threads failed. None of the failures were catistrophic enough to stop the re-indexing from continuing. A list of errors will be returned to the user. * "Unknown Job ID" : The job ID was not recognized. 5. **How do we allow the admin to stop the asynchronous threads?** The end user will need to be able to cleanly stop any currently running re-indsexing threads. We will add a new command to *searchlight-manage* to allow all asynchronous threads associated with a job ID to be killed. This will be considered a catastrophic failure of the re-indexing effort and will result in the previous index being restored. Alternatives ------------ We can always choose to not perform any enhancements. References ==========

commit_message:
Let setup.py compile_catalog process all language files

Two years ago the translation files have been split into several
files, separating the log messages of different log levels from each
other, like X.pot, X-log-warning.pot, X-log-info.pot, and so on.
However, the setup.py command `compile_catalogs`, that comes from the
babel package and compiles the corresponding .po files into .mo
files, only supported one file per python package.  This means that
during packaging `compile_catalogs` never compiled the X-log-*.po
files, so the corresponding translations were always missing.

Since babel 2.3 the domain can be set to a space separated list of
domains.  This change adds the the additional log level files to the
domain list.

The obsolete check that .po and .pot files are valid is removed from
tox.ini.

Change-Id: I149c2254cb04297e598cfd3ca73b24efd0c8ef18
Closes-Bug: #1536226
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/76/319276/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Change-Id: I00e56607c9c762c266957b5c8a1391945460837f

commit_message:
Adding Deklan Dieterly candidacy for Freezer

Change-Id: I00e56607c9c762c266957b5c8a1391945460837f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/election refs/changes/72/368972/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Hi Everyone, I would like to announce my candidacy for PTL for the Freezer Project during the Ocata Cycle. The Freezer Team has done an amazing job of getting the Freezer Project to where it is today. For the last six months, I have been fortunate to have been a contributing member of the Team, and have worked with some amazing, talented people. I would like to continue that effort to help the Team move the project even further along. I see the PTL role as an enabler of the Team to make the project successful by assisting the Team in the following ways: * Drive the feature set under development to enhance the usefulness of the project across the OpenStack ecosystem. * Steer the technical architecture of the Project as much as possible with assistance from the Team. * Facilitate communication between team members by organizing, scheduling, and running team meetings and events. * Handle OpenStack administrative work to allow the Team to focus on development, reviews, bug fixes, and documentation. * Create an inviting welcoming project to enlarge the number of contributors to the Team and create a broader community. * Ensure the quality of the committed code. * Act as an ambassador to other OpenStack Projects to help facilitate tight integration across OpenStack components. Top priorities for the Ocata cycle would be: * Move to a plugin architecture so that users of the Freezer service would be enabled to extend the Freezer functionality to handle their specific backup use cases. * Begin development on a deduplication feature so that Freezer is on par with industrial-strength backup solutions. * Replace usage of the Elasticsearch DB with MySQL DB to better align with OpenStack standards and move to a more appropriate relational model for Freezer configuration data. * Harden the Freezer components so that they are more resilient to failures. * Continue to improve testing coverage by building out the integration tests that have been recently added in the last cycle. * Work the Karbor Project to help discover integration possibilities between Freeze and Karbor. * Engage in Freezer presentations at the OpenStack Design Summits to further Freezer's acceptance and adoption in the OpenStack Community. I would be honored to have your vote. Respectfully yours. Deklan Dieterly (ddieterly)

commit_message:
Override package versions from hiera hash and notify all services in current catalog.

It takes package names and versions from hiera hash to upgrade and override "ensure" parameter in package resource
If any package from the current puppet catalog is upgraded, all the services from the same catalog should be restarted.
If there are no upgraded packages, than no services to be restarted.

Closes-bug: #1616553

Change-Id: Id99bfae07ea0a9e63ad319076743a6101f2675f8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-library refs/changes/61/368861/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: module Puppet::Parser::Functions newfunction(:getpackagegrouphash, :type => :rvalue, :doc => <<-'ENDHEREDOC') do |args| Return a hash with package names as keys and {ensure => "version of a package"} as values. The keys of input hash contains regular expressions which are used to match a list of installed packages. For example: Input: {"^.*apache2-[b,d].*$" => latest} Output: { apache2-bin => {ensure => latest}, apache2-data => {ensure => latest}, } ENDHEREDOC h = Hash.new() args[0].each {|key,value| grep_expr = "grep -Ew #{key}" case lookupvar("osfamily") when "Debian" p_list = %x`dpkg -l | grep -E "^[ a-z]{3}\s" | awk -F" " '{print $2}' | #{grep_expr}` when "RedHat" p_list = %x`rpm -qa | #{grep_expr}` end p_list.split("\n").each {|elem| h[elem] = value unless args[1].include?(elem) } } return h end end

commit_message:
Fix client could not init glance client

Now the client can not initialise glance client,
give the warning msg like:
# murano environment-create test-env
Could not initialise glance client. Image creation will be unavailable.

Have two issue about this:
1. can not get the endpoint correctly, the get endpoint
are all murano's endpoint. This is due to when get the endpoint, if have
the endpoint, will return this endpoint directly.
2. Get the correctly endpoint, init the glance client, give the error:
TypeError: "__init__() got an unexpected keyword argument 'endpoint_type'"
This is due to 'endpoint_type' argument.

Change-Id: I87df369eecc9b79cb7173967729351f7e601edc0
Closes-bug: #1594731
(cherry picked from commit df7ecbc290ae61a56ff98413baa5b84625063911)

commit_message:
Replace six iteration methods with standard ones

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iterXXX
to achieve iterators. We can use dict.XXX instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well.

2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].

[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I801290be0a2afa929a657821c419f935a908c5b4

commit_message:
Fix a keyward arguement error on bay-config

The bay-config command passed 'bay_uuid' keyward arguement to create
cert. It should use 'cluster_uuid' instead.

Closes-Bug: #1621131
Change-Id: I0e4aa115db3004c8244bcf6c9b74f35088d8c7e8

Add magnum.bash_completion
This can support the function of autocomplete for magnum's commands

Closes-Bug: #1614853

commit_message:
Fix races in unit tests

The code is designed to only mutate if the mtime of log_config_append
changes. The tests sometimes go too fast and the mtime doesn't change.

Fix this by always resetting old_time.

Change-Id: I84cdfece2969069c138f46201d84928f26fe4913

commit_message:
config: YAML config

Allow oslo.config files to be YAML as well as INI.

Change-Id: I497adc805e7b88b5be2ce9a80c75a350ec508303
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs refs/changes/68/273468/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: =========== YAML config =========== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/oslo.config/+spec/yaml-config Allow oslo.config files to be YAML as well as INI. Problem description =================== Although the INI format has and continues to serve us faithfully, it has a number of shortcomings: 1. Poor support for lists via ListOpt. 2. And MultiStrOpt. 3. Poor support for long strings. 4. Duplicate sections. 5. Fading popularity. 1) INI doesn't really support lists at all. oslo.config allows lists to be provided either as comma-separated values (ListOpt) or repeated key (MultiStrOpt). ListOpt is OK until you need to use a comma. 2) MultiStrOpt however has imposed noticeable complexity on oslo.config. We have to store all values rather than just the most recently seen and collect these when we get the value for an Opt marked multi=true. Worst of all, this means our INI files no longer follow standard INI semantics. Usually, the last value for a given key wins. This is relied on by tools like crudini and changing these semantics means that we can no longer rely on standard data transformation tooling. 3) INI has no 'linebreak escape', so ListOpts can produce very long lines (EG when listing Nova scheduler filter classnames). 4) It can be confusing that INI allows the same section multiple times within one file. An admin might see one section, imagine it complete and get the wrong idea about the current config. 5) Having to manage multiple file format syntaxes takes unnecessary brain space and leads to tooling proliferation. We should consider allowing operators to specify their config in a file format they are already comfortable with. Proposed change =============== YAML is a popular, human-readable data file format which addresses all of the problems discussed above. This spec proposes to allow config files to be specified as YAML as well as INI format. For example:: [DEFAULT] foo = bar list = one,two [section] # comment multi = oneverylongvaluethatgoesonandonsoitsinconvenienttouseasalistopt multi = twoverylongvaluethatgoesonandonsoitsinconvenienttouseasalistopt This INI config file may be represented in YAML as:: DEFAULT: foo: bar list: - one - two section: # comment multi: - oneverylongvaluethatgoesonandonsoitsinconvenienttouseasalistopt - twoverylongvaluethatgoesonandonsoitsinconvenienttouseasalistopt It will still be necessary to track multi opts over multiple files. There is a small patch up which demonstrates one route to implementation:: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/273117 This patch relies on config files having a ".yml" or ".yaml" suffix for filetype identification. Alternatives ------------ We could pick another file format to support instead of or in addition to YAML. JSON, for example. However all valid JSON is also valid YAML, so this would gain us little. Also JSON is intended for machines to read so it doesn't provide niceties like comments. We could pick XML but following this course logically would require services to publish XML schema documents for their configurations. We could deprecate support for INI as part of this change. This would have a large impact on services and a huge impact on operators. This is not a decision Oslo should make unilaterally and is not proposed by this spec. Impact on Existing APIs ----------------------- This will extend the implicit API of ``ConfigParser._parse_file`` to support YAML files, providing they have a ".yaml" or ".yml" suffix. This also removes the ability to load an INI file with those suffixes, which is arguably a breaking change. On the other hand, this is not something a sensible admin should do. Security impact --------------- PyYAML's ``load`` function allows YAML to call Python functions. This is a security issue. However it's easily avoided by calling ``safe_load``. Although this does involve parsing user-provided data, this data is provided into an existing channel which should already be validating values. Further config files must usually be written by a user with root, if a malicious user has obtained such rights the operator probably has larger concerns. Performance Impact ------------------ No performance impact is expected. Config files are small, megaytes at most, and the PyYAML parser is commonly used. Configuration Impact -------------------- None. Developer Impact ---------------- None. Testing Impact -------------- None. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: alexisl Other contributors: None Milestones ---------- Target Milestone for completion: Newton Work Items ---------- 1. Parse YAML files with PyYAML Incubation ========== Adoption -------- None. Library ------- None. Anticipated API Stabilization ----------------------------- None. Documentation Impact ==================== We must document the YAML config file schema. Dependencies ============ None. References ========== * Mailing list thread: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-January/085132.html * Patch to support YAML logging config: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/259000

commit_message:
log: Spool request logs spec

It's common to run logging at DEBUG, because if you run at anything
higher, when a failure occurs you won't have enough information to
diagnose the failure. What we really want is to log at DEBUG only for
those requests which fail. This spec describes a way to achieve this
by spooling log records.

Change-Id: Iccadb7eb81532d58a3246b50938c6d1007eab584
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo-specs refs/changes/66/227766/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =========================== Log request logs on failure =========================== (this spec is partial, I'll create a BP once it's complete) It's common to run logging at DEBUG, because if you run at anything higher, when a failure occurs you won't have enough information to diagnose the failure. What we really want is to run at at INFO usually and log at DEBUG only for those requests which fail. This spec describes a way to achieve this without inducing temporal paradox. Problem description =================== Most of the time logs are output, stored, rotated and maybe even archived without ever being consulted. If you run at DEBUG, these logs can be enormous and processing can consume non-trivial amounts of resource. However, when you do need them, you absolutely need DEBUG logs. Use Cases ---------- As a cloud administrator of Nova, a user has reported they cannot schedule VMs due to a NoValidHost error. I have to find their request in the nova-scheduler.log, correlate that to the compute log (assuming some scheduling retries occurred) and identify which messages are relevant to their request to debug the issue. This is made more difficult by a high volume of logging but there must be sufficient detail present to fix the problem. As a cloud administrator, I am responsible for our centralised logging store. This consumes memory and disk proportionate to the volume of logs for the time period I store. Holding unnecessary DEBUG logs makes this system more expensive to maintain. Proposed change =============== This spec proposes that logs below INFO are held in a set of buffers. Each task relating to an API request logs to a buffer and the buffer is emptied once the response is sent. DEBUG logs would only be sent to the buffer, while INFO and higher would be duplicated between the buffer and the main log. If the request completes successfully, the buffer is simply thrown away. Otherwise, it is written to a configurable location which defaults to ``/var/log/{service}/requests/`` using the request ID as the filename. Periodic tasks could be dealt with similarly, with each execution treated like an API request. Once the initial work is completed to provide the log-buffering system, services can adopt it for each of their subsystems piece by piece. Services will have to enable log buffering explicitly, it's expected that most services will expose a configuration option and if this is not enabled then log buffering will not be activated. The size of log buffers will also be tunable by services, so they can control how much memory is consumed. Many services will also want to expose this so operators can customise it according to their hardware. Alternatives ------------ The Log Working Group seeks to ensure sufficient diagnostic information is logged at INFO or higher in the event of a failure (sometimes called FFDC, first failure data capture). Ultimately this is the best solution but it's a lot of work to achieve and it's unclear how long this effort will take to complete satisfactorily. In fact I'm not sure if the LWG is still active. Impact on Existing APIs ----------------------- The oslo.log API will be extended to provide a way to request a pool of log buffers and a buffer from that pool. Security impact --------------- None Performance Impact ------------------ Buffering the logs will consume some additional memory. DEBUG logs will be produced even if they're later thrown away. Users not currently logging at DEBUG who choose to enable this feature may see a small CPU impact. Configuration Impact -------------------- (I'll describe these more carefully after some initial feedback) Developer Impact ---------------- None unless you are integrating log buffers into a service. Testing Impact -------------- Unit testing should be sufficient. Deployer impact --------------- If deployers don't enable the feature - none. Otherwise they'll need to tune buffer size and set up logrotate or similar for the new directories. Otherwise their RAM/disk may/will fill up. Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: lxsli Other contributors: None Milestones ---------- TBD Work Items ---------- * Provide code to implement a log buffer. * Provide a way to write a log buffer to disk. * Provide a LOG object which dispatches logs to Python logging and/or the right log buffer. * Provide proof-of-concept implementation in a service, for example Nova API request processing. Documentation Impact ==================== Need to describe the feature and its config options. Dependencies ============ None References ========== * https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/LogWorkingGroup * https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Meetings/log-wg

commit_message:
Fix connection init when session is provided

There are cases where an existing session could be reused when building
a connection. We don't have to initialize an authenticator in those
cases because users are not providing any credentials for such use
cases.

Change-Id: I3b242abf8ebd18a44ca1d58ab11b90a96f19e1c9
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/07/368907/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
port 'up' and 'down' status notification

This adds the ability syn DF db port status
to Neutron db by monitoring ovsdb at each
compute node.

This patch handles the Logical port status up/down updates
At startup, it catches the initial 'create' events from
compute node and updates the port status if not in sync.

If the Logical_Port.up changes from False to True
it sets the port status to 'ACTIVE' so that neutron server
can send 'network-vif-plugged' event to nova.

If the Logical_Port.up changes from True to False
it sets the port status to 'DOWN' so that neutron server
can send 'network-vif-unplugged' event to nova.

Change-Id: I2b6427619c2f05519b3060badf6b0ff7983ba746
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/dragonflow refs/changes/47/334147/12 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================== Port status update =================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/dragonflow/+spec/allowed-address-pairs This blueprint describes how to support port status update for Dragonflow. Problem Description ===================== Port satus update feature will enable synchronization of port sutatus between DF db and neturon DB. There is only port status in DF database updated after ports are created, leaving Neutron DB port status unchanged.Because of the status of port in Neutron being same before and after DF db processed, thus no event sent to nova. Proposed Change =============== Design principle ---------------- The pricinple is very simple: DF ML2 mechanism driver subscribe special topic which is sent by publisher from each compute node When nova create a vm, it will call neutron API create_port. local controller on compute node is notified to process the port, and after that, it changes DF db, then publishes event DF ML2 mechanism driver will update relative data in Neutron db afer get message from publisher with the specific topic. Publisher subscriber pattern ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Port status update feature depends on the sub-pub function shown in the following diagram. When there is a port status change, for example, nova create a vm which scheduled to compute A. Publisher A will send event with the topic(port_status_update specific).On receiving an event from publisher, the subscriber in server node will do callback function, and finally change port status in neutron db. +--------------+ <----+ Publisher A | | +--------------+ +------------+ | +---------+ <----+--------------+ | Subscriber <---+ Topic A + + | Publisher B | +------------+ | +---------+ <----+--------------+ | +--------------+ <----+ Publisher C | +--------------+ The topic for port status """"""""""""""""""""""""" A special topic defined for port update status event shared by all tenants. Pros and Cons ------------- Pros Neutron server perfermance would be considered while there are lots of publishers on each compute node and only several subscribersin server node Cons There are rarely chagnes to the previous architecture, because of using pub-sub function.

commit_message:
Merge tag '1.4.0' into debian/newton

osprofiler 1.4.0 release

  [ Corey Bryant ]
  * New upstream release.
  * d/control: Align (Build-)Depends with upstream.
  * d/p/do-not-use-build-time-in-docs.patch: Dropped. Fixed upstream.
  * d/p/adds-import-warnings.patch: Dropped. Fixed upstream.

  [ Thomas Goirand ]
  * Using OpenStack's Gerrit as VCS URLs.

commit_message:
__ne__() unit tests & have special methods use (self, other)

Commit 41c0413adb6076d6c43a0de0b0b9be5d890551ef added the __ne__()
method. This adds unit tests for the method.

Add some additional unit tests for the special methods.

Use the standard way[1] of defining the special methods __eq__() and
__gt__() with (self, other) as the arguments

https://docs.python.org/2/reference/datamodel.html#special-method-names

commit_message:
Add support of Availability Zones API

Change-Id: Ie7ff8234b5cd4a20d94148c7512b2d5cd621e190
Closes-Bug: #1622540
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-manilaclient refs/changes/46/368746/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2016 Mirantis, Inc. # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import ddt import mock from manilaclient import api_versions from manilaclient.tests.unit import utils from manilaclient.v2 import availability_zones @ddt.ddt class AvailabilityZoneTest(utils.TestCase): def _get_manager(self, microversion): version = api_versions.APIVersion(microversion) mock_microversion = mock.Mock(api_version=version) return availability_zones.AvailabilityZoneManager( api=mock_microversion) def _get_resource_path(self, microversion): if (api_versions.APIVersion(microversion) > api_versions.APIVersion("2.6")): return availability_zones.RESOURCE_PATH return availability_zones.RESOURCE_PATH_LEGACY @ddt.data("2.6", "2.7", api_versions.MIN_VERSION, api_versions.MAX_VERSION) def test_list(self, microversion): manager = self._get_manager(microversion) resource_path = self._get_resource_path(microversion) self.mock_object(manager, "_list") result = manager.list() manager._list.assert_called_once_with( resource_path, availability_zones.RESOURCE_NAME) self.assertEqual(manager._list.return_value, result)

commit_message:
Deletion of in-progress stack

Unlike in legacy engine case, the stack in in-progress state couldn't be
deleted in convergence. This patch fixes this issue so that the
behaviour is compatible.

Change-Id: I79bb14d5d7744ba2a012e23e690608dc7db1fbc5
Closes-Bug: #1545063
Closes-Bug: #1592374

commit_message:
Update README to reflect ML2 Exception in Dir Tree

Will place all ML2 related plugins into its own directory.
Updated README to reflect the exception for ML2.

Change-Id: Ibf5a827e70ac6c6079f68f3a93fcd3de21bd7934
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/47/357947/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: The exception for the flat directory structure are ML2 plugins. All ML2 plugins should fall under the ml2 subdirectory and the module should match the corresponding table name (i.e. ml2_gre_allocations).

commit_message:
Create api-ref-src job

It is extremely useful if we can see the os-api-ref changes on
existing projects, this creates a job where we use the source version
of os-api-ref with an existing project api-ref tree (nova in this case
as it uses most of the features).

Change-Id: Ia7f8ed9b9a726bc2178a4ee7691353f4e12256eb

commit_message:
neutron: don't trace on port not found when unbinding ports

There is a race in the gate when deleting an instance and
deallocating the network at the same time that preexisting
ports attached to the instance are being deleted. So when
nova goes to unbind the port it's already gone and we log
an exception trace in the n-cpu logs. We shouldn't actually
care if the port isn't found when unbinding it from an instance,
so this change handles that case and logs it at debug rather
than an exception trace.

Change-Id: Ia95c626cefcb1e099e11d3bf5a651ad5d5f9406f
Closes-Bug: #1621883

commit_message:
Add config parameter to collect-logs ci-script

- Require an input mechanism for users to handle varying doc creation
configs.
- Topology/config should use `--config`, other settings should use
  `-e/--extra-vars`

commit_message:
Allow aggregations in search requests

Allows aggregations to be specified in search requests (either as
'aggs' or 'aggregations'). See Elasticsearch DSL for details
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/search-aggregations.html

The 'global' aggregation is not allowed because it bypasses the search
query -
https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/search-aggregations-bucket-global-aggregation.html

Change-Id: If0938a1b9d26155e457f9a85e33018af26dd75bb
Implements: blueprint allow-aggregation-query

added_lines: def _validate_aggregations(self, context, aggregations): if aggregations: # Check aggregations against policy try: self.policy_enforcer.enforce(context, 'search:query:aggregations', context.policy_target) except exception.Forbidden as e: raise webob.exc.HTTPForbidden(explanation=e.msg) # Reject any requests including the 'global' aggregation type # because it bypasses RBAC. 'global' aggregations can only occur # at the top level, so we only need to check that level for agg_name, agg_definition in six.iteritems(aggregations): if 'global' in agg_definition: msg = _LE( "Aggregation '%s' contains the 'global' aggregation " "which is not allowed") % agg_name LOG.error(msg) raise webob.exc.HTTPForbidden(explanation=msg) return aggregations aggregations = body.pop('aggregations', None) if not aggregations: aggregations = body.pop('aggs', None) elif 'aggs' in body: raise webob.exc.HTTPBadRequest("A request cannot include both " "'aggs' and 'aggregations'") aggregations = self._validate_aggregations(request.context, aggregations) if aggregations is not None: query_params['query']['aggregations'] = aggregations

commit_message:
Handle nova error states correctly

When nova servers transition to error states during build there's
no final .end event, and the final update notifications were getting
ignored by the transition state logic. This patch adds a full API index
call from the final error update event.

Change-Id: I65f5542d3c9290b321bd2a86e9123d8668ce7ef9
Closes-Bug: #1616674

commit_message:
Freezer-scheduler in devstack

Now, freezer-scheduler is not running in devstack auto, and the
screen log is not found. the patch fix it, that freezer-scheduler
automatic startup and clean_freezer_scheduler

Change-Id: I95900f992988ebeb2a2a73d66d2789f380057981
Implements: blueprint freezer-scheduler-devstack-running
Closes-Bug: #1578988

subject: Handle outputs with an OutputDefinition class
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-06 17:20:18.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/e5c32a8af599a4cac3d7dbfb98f0f9f76e46dbd9', 'message': 'Handle outputs with an OutputDefinition class

This is the last remaining area of the code where we were slinging around
CloudFormation-formatted snippets of template. Replace it with a proper API
along the lines of ResourceDefinition.

The default implementation of the new template.Template.outputs() method is
equivalent to what we have previously done spread throughout the code, so
that third-party Template plugins will not be affected until they have had
time to write their own custom implementations.

commit_message:
Handle outputs with an OutputDefinition class

This is the last remaining area of the code where we were slinging around
CloudFormation-formatted snippets of template. Replace it with a proper API
along the lines of ResourceDefinition.

The default implementation of the new template.Template.outputs() method is
equivalent to what we have previously done spread throughout the code, so
that third-party Template plugins will not be affected until they have had
time to write their own custom implementations.

Change-Id: Ib65dad6db55ae5dafab473bebba67e841ca9a984

commit_message:
[WIP] Upgrade fails if neutron_lbaas isn't set

This ensures the upgrade doesn't fail if neutron_lbaas isn't set.
This commit only makes sense if neutron_lbaas doesn't need to be set
at all times.

Change-Id: I958b93596ba65cd4c798ec34227f4284611e36c8
Signed-off-by: Jean-Philippe Evrard <jean-philippe@evrard.me>

commit_message:
[ops-guide] Add enterprise troubleshooting information

Add the following tips and procedures:
1. Installing OS CLI tools
2. How to assign a lostIP address back to a tenant
3. Manage floating IP addresses between instances
4. Retrieving an IP address after deleting an
instance with the port still attached

Change-Id: I1360d44162da42fe4970c793f7fff0977ccdce5e
Implements: blueprint ops-guide-improvements
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/55/366455/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Guide <http://docs.openstack.org/admin-guide/dashboard.html>`_ for.. tip:: To perform testing and orchestration, it is usually easier to install the OpenStack CLI tools in a dedicated VM in the cloud. We recommend that you keep the VM installation simple. All the tools should be installed from a single OpenStack release version. If you need to run tools from multiple OpenStack releases, then we recommend that you run with multiple VMs that are each running a dedicated version.

commit_message:
Lower Ceph rados object max size to fit in ext4

This will prevend OSDs from failing when backed by a file system
formatted with ext4.

Also see: http://tracker.ceph.com/issues/16187

Depends-On: Id487d6d656e88dfe29eac80c378058551c92dfd9
Change-Id: I3aa24b92e793adf28653e58c1718f74bd93b5931

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-12 15:01:11.000000000', 'files': ['bootstrap/sync/etc/systemd/system/default.target.wants/setup-bootdev.service', 'bootstrap/sync/usr/lib/systemd/system/setup-bootdev.service', 'bootstrap/module.mk', 'bootstrap/sync/usr/lib/systemd/system/fix-configs-on-startup.service'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main/commit/2dd1a94d6298d32a95d80bb5c8c0c55325f9ad59', 'message': 'Fix race between setup-bootdev and network

Redesign systemd units in the following way:
1) Move setup-bootdev unit from /etc to /usr and create
symlink to /usr. That prevents systemd to create unit
from init.d script.
2) Add dependencies to setup-bootdev to run it before
network.service.
3) Add fix-configs-on-startup unit and force to run it
after network-online target.
Now we have following well defined order:
setup-bootdev -> network -> fix-configs-on-startup ->
->(mcollective,ntp and other services)

Change-Id: Iefa83096924259efbc4eb30359b9a19b3466e121
Closes-Bug: #1621468
'}]
commit_message:
Fix race between setup-bootdev and network

Redesign systemd units in the following way:
1) Move setup-bootdev unit from /etc to /usr and create
symlink to /usr. That prevents systemd to create unit
from init.d script.
2) Add dependencies to setup-bootdev to run it before
network.service.
3) Add fix-configs-on-startup unit and force to run it
after network-online target.
Now we have following well defined order:
setup-bootdev -> network -> fix-configs-on-startup ->
->(mcollective,ntp and other services)

Change-Id: Iefa83096924259efbc4eb30359b9a19b3466e121
Closes-Bug: #1621468
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-main refs/changes/99/368899/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [Unit] Description=Setup configs on bootstrap startup Wants=network-online.target Before=mcollective.service ntpdate.service ntpd.service After=network-online.target [Service] Type=oneshot Restart=no TimeoutSec=5min ExecStart=/usr/bin/fix-configs-on-startup RemainAfterExit=no

commit_message:
Make undercloud service workers configurable

This enables us to configure the number of workers for the
undercloud services; which is useful for when resources are limited.

This is configured via a variable called 'undercloud_workers' which
can set the workers for all the services. And each individual service
can be configured too. The pattern is
'undercloud_<service name>_workers'.

Change-Id: I9d381081216cae366e7d2c2896c004ff002ef797

commit_message:
Fix 'config_drive' and 'networks' for compute server

The 'config_drive' property was missing fro the compute server class.
This patch adds it. The 'networks' property is allowed to be specified
as 'auto', 'none' or a list of network properties. It was forced to be a
dict previously. This patch removes that constraint.

Change-Id: I1d8673935a751d8a319eb711e9592c6ffd8929ef
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstacksdk refs/changes/37/368837/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Compress all gathered logs for CI

In order to ensure that all logs gathered do not take up
too much space on CI systems, the logs are gzipped.

In order to make them viewable via a browser from the CI
log host, the files are renamed to .txt before compressing
them.

Closes-Bug: #1620849
Change-Id: I71e629c505770b8e95a6328c79d46ab45ee0300a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible refs/changes/70/366570/9 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: find "${GATE_LOG_DIR}" -type f ! -name '*.gz' -exec gzip "{}" \;

commit_message:
Fix `openstack cluster action list` bug

Before this patch, `openstack cluster action list` can't list actions.
Also, find a action's anohter problem in senlin server code.

commit_message:
Extract the keystone cert generation into a function

This allows the functionality to be used without writing the
contents out to a file.

Change-Id: Ia9d16597b83e2efeee5ab1c7fb0251cb6e60eaf8

commit_message:
Revert "Add __ne__() function for API Version object"

We're using functools.total_ordering which adds __ne__ for us.

This reverts commit 41c0413adb6076d6c43a0de0b0b9be5d890551ef.

Change-Id: I2d52bb9619f29f7cc1da0c6bc9d69f9d79996bfa

commit_message:
Separate osft checkers for acceptance test

In test mixed_components_murano_sahara_ceilometer
we have one checker for all ostf sets with default
timeout 30 minutes.
Sepatated general ostf checker to two different.
Uppped timeout for platform ostf.
Closes-bug: #1622595

Change-Id: I579515202cd2b2e0e560da3b57e74f09493ec641

commit_message:
OneView test nodes to use dynamic allocation

Now that the dynamic allocation feature has merged, the testing of *_oneview
drivers shall use the new allocation model on the CI infra. To allow this, we're
adding a new parameter to the hwinfo file to indicate when the
dynamic_allocation flag should be added to the node and managing the logic when
it is present.

Change-Id: I40ed9abe96dd15701b31e0ad0b7d71ff065488ef

added_lines: applied_server_profile_uri=$(echo $hardware_info |awk '{print $6}') local dynamic_allocation dynamic_allocation=$(echo $hardware_info |awk '{print $7}') dynamic_allocation=$(trueorfalse False dynamic_allocation) if [[-z "$applied_server_profile_uri"]] node_options+=" -i applied_server_profile_uri=$applied_server_profile_uri" fi if [[ "$dynamic_allocation" == "True" ]]; then node_options+=" -i dynamic_allocation=$dynamic_allocation" fi

commit_message:
Support 'debug' parameter in Astute message

Before this change Nailgun send Astute info about debug
mode for task in case of task deployment in every task.
After this change it will send once in main message.
Astute setup it by itself.

Change-Id: I3fee53978e652009b1ef2f7868525d65a113ab01
Closes-Bug: #1618774
(cherry picked from commit f4872de2905648704be2ef6ca1c4dddf58637830)

commit_message:
Add *args, **kwargs to ModalBackdropMixin's init method

Before this change ModalBackdropMixin called super(...).__init__()
without arguments. This imposed restrictions on what classes this
mixin could have been mixed into, i.e. only classes, that do not accept
any parameters.
This proved to be a problem for murano-dashboard, since it uses this
mixin (indirectly through ModalFormMixin) and mixes it into a class,
that accepts parameters to it's init method.
This change allows to use ModalBackdropMixin with classes that have
init methods with parameters.

Change-Id: I6155476738021b784ef7e643c968f1d784b15906
Closes-Bug: #1582816
(cherry picked from commit bb1547c8abcc0d0d3dc4a3199e8e8bd1b5527c12)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/horizon refs/changes/13/323713/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): super(ModalBackdropMixin, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs)

commit_message:
Fix ironic-multitenant-network job

Recently neutron public network type has been changed by default
to flat [0]. It caused ironic-multitenant-network job to failure.
This patch update settings in ironic/settings untill apropriate changes
are merged to project-config and developer documentation.

Reference:
[0] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/346282/
Change-Id: Icd83203f1c61f71c96324c532baabe3a924cf617

commit_message:
Bump pyghmi version to 1.0.9

This patch is bumping the pyghmi version to 1.0.9. This version fixes
a problem which tolerates multiple UDP clients reusing the same UDP ports.

Change-Id: I5e3c340b229a7ea8a2afe26bbfad38a47932b45e
Related-Bug: #1548652

commit_message:
Unit tests of quota command refactor

Do refactor for quota command related unit tests, remove
useless code, add new tests to cover '--volume-type' and
'--class' option in "quota set" command and add the
volume quota fake object.

Change-Id: Iaf214740e98db1bfb4c739e810bac1c5ba6e9625
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-openstackclient refs/changes/85/352285/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
scenario003: disable sahara testing on RDO

Sahara upstream moved the Tempest plugin to another separated
repository.
Until RDO team build the package (see bugzilla link), let's disable
Sahara tempest tests on centos7 runs, so we can continue to promote our
CI without interruption.

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1318765

Change-Id: Ic05e6e9c7a3217cb5bc61f02d5b507de52c551af
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-openstack-integration refs/changes/24/368824/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: $ssl_enabled = false $trove_enabled = false $sahara_enabled = true $trove_enabled = true # https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1318765 $sahara_enabled = false sahara => $sahara_enabled,

in support of neutron routed networks.

subject: Add OVS transaction mutate support
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-08-05 17:39:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn/commit/cc92cdcb6a698388ab52069821934b499d84255e', 'message': 'WIP: Add OVS transaction mutate support

This patch set leverages OVS transaction mutate support to
improve performance of the following operations:
 - Add and delete logical switch port
 - Add and delete logical router port
 - Add and delete logical switch ACL
 - Add and delete logical router static routes
 - Add and delete address set addresses

The OVS transaction mutate support will only be used if available.
If not available, a full transaction will be done as before.

commit_message:
Add OVS transaction mutate support

This patch set leverages OVS transaction mutate support to
improve performance of the following operations:
 - Add and delete logical switch ports
 - Add and delete logical router ports
 - Add and delete logical switch ACLs
 - Add and delete logical router static routes
 - Add and delete address set addresses

The OVS transaction mutate support will only be used if available.
If not available, a full transaction will be done as before.

ML Discussion:
- http://openvswitch.org/pipermail/dev/2016-August/077083.html

OVS Patch Dependencies Merged:
- https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/656424/
- https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/656425/
- https://patchwork.ozlabs.org/patch/662137/

Closes-Bug: #1610347
Change-Id: Idf4ec4ee0db7949fa68d0ab98ed77fc6e892bad8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/61/351861/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # TODO(rtheis): These wrapper functions are't needed once networking-ovn # requirements are updated to require an ovs python version with mutation # support. def _is_ovs_mutate_available(row): # Checking for the addvalue method should be sufficient. return callable(getattr(row, 'addvalue', None)) def _addvalue_to_list(row, column, new_value): # If available, use mutate support to add the value. if _is_ovs_mutate_available(row): row.addvalue(column, new_value) else: row.verify(column) column_values = getattr(row, column, []) if new_value not in column_values: column_values.append(new_value) setattr(row, column, column_values) def _delvalue_from_list(row, column, old_value): # If available, use mutate support to delete the value. if _is_ovs_mutate_available(row): row.delvalue(column, old_value) else: row.verify(column) column_values = getattr(row, column, []) if old_value in column_values: column_values.remove(old_value) setattr(row, column, column_values) def _updatevalues_in_list(row, column, new_values=None, old_values=None): new_values = new_values or [] old_values = old_values or [] # If available, use mutate support to add/delete the values. if _is_ovs_mutate_available(row): for new_value in new_values: row.addvalue(column, new_value) for old_value in old_values: row.delvalue(column, old_value) else: row.verify(column) column_values = getattr(row, column, []) for new_value in new_values: if new_value not in column_values: column_values.append(new_value) for old_value in old_values: if old_value in column_values: column_values.remove(old_value) setattr(row, column, column_values) # add the newly created port to existing lswitch _addvalue_to_list(lswitch, 'ports', port.uuid) _delvalue_from_list(lswitch, 'ports', lport) _addvalue_to_list(lrouter, 'ports', lrouter_port) _delvalue_from_list(lrouter, 'ports', lrouter_port) _addvalue_to_list(lswitch, 'acls', row.uuid) _updatevalues_in_list(lswitch, 'acls', old_values=acls_to_del) # TODO(rtheis): Refactor to use ovs mutate support when available. _addvalue_to_list(lrouter, 'static_routes', row.uuid) _delvalue_from_list(lrouter, 'static_routes', route) _updatevalues_in_list( addrset, 'addresses', new_values=self.addrs_add, old_values=self.addrs_remove)
deleted_lines: ports = getattr(lswitch, 'ports', []) lswitch.verify('ports') # add the newly created port to existing lswitch ports.append(port.uuid) setattr(lswitch, 'ports', ports) ports = getattr(lswitch, 'ports', []) lswitch.verify('ports') ports.remove(lport) setattr(lswitch, 'ports', ports) lrouter.verify('ports') lrouter_ports = getattr(lrouter, 'ports', []) if lrouter_port not in lrouter_ports: lrouter_ports.append(lrouter_port) setattr(lrouter, 'ports', lrouter_ports) lrouter.verify('ports') lrouter_ports = getattr(lrouter, 'ports', []) if (lrouter_port in lrouter_ports): lrouter_ports.remove(lrouter_port) setattr(lrouter, 'ports', lrouter_ports) lswitch.verify('acls') acls = getattr(lswitch, 'acls', []) acls.append(row.uuid) setattr(lswitch, 'acls', acls) lswitch.verify('acls') acls.remove(acl) setattr(lswitch, 'acls', acls) lrouter.verify('static_routes') static_routes = getattr(lrouter, 'static_routes', []) static_routes.append(row.uuid) setattr(lrouter, 'static_routes', static_routes) lrouter.verify('static_routes') static_routes.remove(route) setattr(lrouter, 'static_routes', static_routes) addrset.verify('addresses') addresses_col = getattr(addrset, 'addresses', []) if self.addrs_add: # OVN will ignore duplicate addresses. for addr_add in self.addrs_add: addresses_col.append(addr_add) if self.addrs_remove: # OVN will ignore addresses that don't exist. for addr_remove in self.addrs_remove: if addr_remove in addresses_col: addresses_col.remove(addr_remove) setattr(addrset, 'addresses', addresses_col)

commit_message:
Fix NetworkExplorer creation

After I4dbf40c65042e9a354f3bfadfcd63a63e6e3e418 NetworkExplorer
require CloudRegion subclass in owners chain

Change-Id: I238e3bd6792312e780bd565c9cd9cf2735f5e25c
Closes-bug: #1620271
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano refs/changes/50/363550/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: - $._netExplorer: new(sys:NetworkExplorer, $this._region)

subject: Create artifact of config used during deployment
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-09-02 15:41:17.000000000', 'files': ['ci-scripts/collect-logs.sh', 'config/general_config/minimal.yml', 'quickstart.sh'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-quickstart/commit/8eaa4e6147c77a29e73800695714d8d74659882d', 'message': 'Create artifact of config used during deployment

We require a way to determine which configuration was used during
deployment with quickstart.sh after builds have completed.

commit_message:
Create artifact of config used during deployment

We require a way to determine which configuration was used during
deployment with quickstart.sh after builds have completed.

- Echoing config used in quickstart.sh to local artifact
- Move artcl_create_docs_payload into respective config file
- Update ci-scripts/collect-logs.sh to consume correct config file

Change-Id: If6adb733e151d5e0453ea36829fdf43d0dbd9089

commit_message:
Drop unused directory in tox

The Oslo team has moved all previously incubated code from
the 'openstack/oslo-incubator' repository into separate library
repositories and released those libraries to the Python Package,
so the directory should be removed.

Change-Id: I9b86db737a8b98cf172c5fdf532ebe483b98b7f5

commit_message:
Add a basic install guide

This installs the basic directories and content pointing to the current
Ironic Installation Guide. Simply having this in our repo will not lead
to it being published, this is only the first step. Having these items
in our repository is a good first step to building out our install
guide.

Change-Id: I6a0e69bd3b6f5074ae61505f82f27bcf9df84bab
Partial-bug: #1612278
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/94/363294/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: [testenv:install-guide] commands = sphinx-build -a -E -W -d install-guide/build/doctrees -b html install-guide/source install-guide/build/html

commit_message:
Add standalone_ports_supported to portgroup - DB

This patch is a database change to portgroup object that adds
a new field standalone_ports_supported. The field indicates
whether interfaces that belongs to the portgroup may be used
as individual interfaces. For example when hardware doesn't
support portchannel fallback.

Related-Bug: #1618754
Change-Id: I24c2408a0769b630ce275f8688705fc35efd41a8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/53/361053/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def _check_60cf717201bc(self, engine, data): portgroups = db_utils.get_table(engine, 'portgroups') col_names = [column.name for column in portgroups.c] self.assertIn('individual_mode_supported', col_names) self.assertIsInstance(portgroups.c.individual_mode_supported.type, sqlalchemy.types.Boolean)

commit_message:
Configure qemu when Calico network type is set

Previously the qemu.conf was being configured by the Calico tasks
in Neutron, which is improper as Neutron is not managing the
libvirt/qemu installation.

Change-Id: Id2cfa3353543fecd55f1135abad89f07071e2f60
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible-os_nova refs/changes/85/368285/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {% if nova_network_type == 'calico' %} # Calico specific qemu settings # Information available at: # http://docs.projectcalico.org/en/latest/ubuntu-opens-install.html clear_emulator_capabilities = 0 user = "root" group = "root" cgroup_device_acl = [ "/dev/null", "/dev/full", "/dev/zero", "/dev/random", "/dev/urandom", "/dev/ptmx", "/dev/kvm", "/dev/kqemu", "/dev/rtc", "/dev/hpet", "/dev/net/tun", ] {% endif %}

commit_message:
Paramiko: poll buffer status instead of channel due to sock closure

Paramiko: poll buffer status instead of channel due to sock closure:
if channel.recv_ready():
    result.stdout += poll_stream(src=stdout, verbose=verbose)
if channel.recv_stderr_ready():
    result.stderr += poll_stream(src=stderr, verbose=verbose)

Change-Id: I74d445d8970d54a340ae45ad8731c709fdcfe388

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-24 12:11:53.000000000', 'files': ['meta/io.murano/Resources/murano-init.sh', 'meta/io.murano/Resources/murano-agent.conf', 'meta/io.murano/Resources/murano-agent.service', 'meta/io.murano/Resources/murano-agent'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/murano/commit/383dc3194e1519095d5a0e2394296f15e04918b1', 'message': 'Change incorrect murano-agent bin file location

During cloud-init related improvements murano-agent location was
specified for the pip-style installation. This leads to unability
to deploy the apps on the images with pre-installed murano-agent
without network. This commit create a symlink to the pre-installed agent
in place where pip usually installs packages.

Change-Id: I8d90d33dc0a1c36ac4524f8f3b82223c23829126
Closes-Bug: #1570962
(cherry picked from commit 15df963544f4dc21492dd8641235081c85ce4025)

commit_message:
Change incorrect murano-agent bin file location

During cloud-init related improvements murano-agent location was
specified for the pip-style installation. This leads to unability
to deploy the apps on the images with pre-installed murano-agent
without network. This commit create a symlink to the pre-installed agent
in place where pip usually installs packages.

Change-Id: I8d90d33dc0a1c36ac4524f8f3b82223c23829126
Closes-Bug: #1570962
(cherry picked from commit 15df963544f4dc21492dd8641235081c85ce4025)

commit_message:
Add --node arg to 'ironic port-list'

Adds an optional '--node' argument (the name or UUID of a node) to
the 'ironic port-list' command. If specified, the list will only
include ports of the specified node.

Change-Id: I903cf1a6f0406000be034a361b1e8374eea3ae93
Closes-Bug: #1616242

commit_message:
Setup CORS settings for tripleo-ui

Add the required CORS setting to hieradata and make sure the services
include *::cors classes.

Change-Id: I89b736f30364cae999676cc985a67686b5a9810e

commit_message:
Introduce 'enable_ui' option

The new 'enable_ui' option installs the TripleO UI. It is enabled by default.

Depends-On: Ib9d8643da3f51171495fcb8b64d1a7ca86cd66bc

Change-Id: I7c26aa7a6a4a8f7044c85715eae80342ea9b9dc9

commit_message:
Revise feature items

This patch revises FEATURES.rst to add an item about
profile/policy versioning support. It also removes two
items that have been in progress/finished.

Change-Id: I7a2779b05f27e50e4de4dd0a75b18edbf842dc32
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/senlin refs/changes/94/367094/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Profile/Policy versioning support ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ Profile/Policy schema could vary over time for properties being added or deprecated. Versioning support is important for keeping backward compatibility when profile/poilicy evolve.
deleted_lines: API versioning support ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ This support can help to improve the stability and compatibility of Senlin API interface. We can learn some experience from what Nova has done for providing API version control. Versioned Object Support ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ oslo.versionedobjects is a lib provides a generic versioned object model that is RPC-friendly, with inbuilt serialization, field typing, and remotable method calls. We can use it to promote the upgrading capatibility of Senlin service.

commit_message:
Rework nova server update logic

This patch reworks the nova server update logic so that both server name
and password can be updated together with image change (via rebuild),
and they can be updated separately if necessary.

Change-Id: I6ac42f83d2aacf522193096bdea5e57cfea9d542

commit_message:
Add network segment create, delete and update support

Add network segment create, delete and update support. This patch set
includes the following:
  - Proxy create, delete and update interfaces
  - Support for new name and description properties
  - Documentation update for supported network types
  - Unit test updates
  - Functional test updates

The documentation provides a caution notice since this support
is a work in progress and is subject to change.

Change-Id: Ib194125162057fccb4e951587c2fa4ec2e2f098c
Partially-Implements: blueprint routed-networks

commit_message:
implement minimal metric collection

This change implements metric collection system using influxdata
(influxdb and telegraf) with visulization using grafana. No
Dashboard automation is provided at this time however a template
dashboard can be used by importing the JSON files from the
dashboards directory.

Change-Id: I5445b01170054393a31afc2a20ffb3ea4eda1209
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add ansible_host to dynamic inventory

Since ansible_ssh_host is deprecated per
http://docs.ansible.com/ansible/intro_inventory.html
this change will allow add the new ansible_host var to the
inventory so ansible_ssh_host references can begin transitioning
to ansible_host. Once that is complete ansible_ssh_host can be
removed.

Change-Id: I8e7497a7eb7145a5908995cbc1991bfe4efa5946
Closes-Bug: #1622281

commit_message:
Fail deployment if q-dhcp and OVN_NATIVE_DHCP enabled

Fail deployment if both q-dhcp and OVN_NATIVE_DHCP are enabled. Such
deployments introduce unnecessary neutron DHCP provisioning blocks
and still don't provide DHCP metadata proxy support.

Depends-On: I9f6b23247df01c40c127b0e9daecd12f5721ff50
Change-Id: I0f0241c68b9cf83d8c83a9c9695075ad71ce51ca
Related-Bug: #1514488
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/networking-ovn refs/changes/96/361096/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(rtheis): Conventional and native DHCP are not supported at the # same time. There are a couple problems with such a setup: # 1) Neutron still creates DHCP provisioning blocks when launching # instances. As a result, the conventional DHCP agent must be # up and remove the DHCP provisioning blocks or instances will # fail to launch. # 2) Even though the conventional DHCP agent sets up a metadata # proxy, instances aren't able to access the proxy via # "curl http://169.254.169.254". # It may be possible to leverage the conventional DHCP agent for its # internal DNS support in such a setup, but that is not confirmed. if is_service_enabled q-dhcp ; then if [[ "$OVN_NATIVE_DHCP" == "True" ]]; then die $LINENO "The q-dhcp service must be disabled with OVN_NATIVE_DHCP set to True." fi fi

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/i18n refs/changes/63/360663/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: Creating Language Team ====================== OpenStack I18n team is a team to coordinate all language translations and cooperation with the I18n team and the development teams. I18n team usually has a working plan. Although each language team could follow the I18n team working plan, your team may also decide your own work items and priorities as a language team. If you want to create a language team and you want to be a coordinator, please follow below steps: 1. Follow :doc:`the step <official_translator>` to register an ID in the translation website. 2. Write an email to "openstack-i18n@lists.openstack.org" to introduce yourself and the language team you want to create, together with your ID on Zanata. 3. When your request is approved, add an item in "Local Translation Teams" in the wiki page, create a wiki page under page `I18nTeam <https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/I18nTeam/team>`_ (for example, I18nTeam/team/zh_cn) to introduce your team, with the following information at least: the contact information, the web page, and the work items. Then, your locale translation team is created successfully. You can enroll more people to join and start your translation work. Keep in mind to work with your `local user group <https://groups.openstack.org/>`_ and the `OpenStack Ambassadors <https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Community/AmbassadorProgram>`_ to raise awareness and gather members :)

commit_message:
Enable multipath flag for volume migration

Multipath settings are not taken into account when doing volume
migration. Multipath settings should be passed in to brick_get_
connector_properties.

Change-Id: I3d1534dc84fb9a751f82a9501f014f016728d026
Closes-Bug: #1603955

commit_message:
Simplified debian/rules with os-pkg-tools >= 52~

1/ Removed already in pkgos.make:
PYTHONS:=$(shell pyversions -vr)
PYTHON3S:=$(shell py3versions -vr)

2/ Using pkgos-dh_auto_{test,install}

3/ Build-Depends: on version >= 52~ of openstack-pkg-tools

commit_message:
Prevent AppDispatcher from interrupting app execution

Since every app is standalone, if one app fails to execute handler,
others should not be affected.

commit_message:
Use delorean rabbitmq

For centos, we should be using the RDO repositories to provide
rabbitmq-server.  This version is updated with bug fixes and provides
a more stable experience then using rabbitmq.com builds.

Co-Authored-by: Jeffrey Zhang <zhang.lei.fly@gmail.com>
Co-Authored-by: Michal (inc0) Jastrzebski <inc007@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1621460
Change-Id: Ib0eafc5da4397756fbdd837520b15543180ce229

commit_message:
Add 'openstack overcloud plan create' command

This uses the new Mistral actions and workflows to create a
plan with the tripleo heat templates. Templates can either
be provided by the user or the default templates on the
undercloud can be used.

Closes-Bug: #1616014
Change-Id: I4f82fda01215b9a45669862ef26c69421fdaad59
(cherry picked from commit 2c0fecf69ce4889b208b60400eccd935ee32a8d6)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-tripleoclient refs/changes/88/368788/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import uuidfrom tripleoclient.workflows import plan_management class CreatePlan(command.Command): """Create a deployment plan""" log = logging.getLogger(__name__ + ".CreatePlan") def get_parser(self, prog_name): parser = super(CreatePlan, self).get_parser(prog_name) parser.add_argument( 'name', help=_('The name of the plan, which is used for the object ' 'storage container, workflow environment and orchestration ' 'stack names.')) parser.add_argument( '--templates', help=_('The directory containing the Heat templates to deploy. ' 'If this isn\'t provided, the templates packaged on the ' 'Undercloud will be used.'), ) return parser def take_action(self, parsed_args): self.log.debug("take_action(%s)" % parsed_args) clients = self.app.client_manager name = parsed_args.name if parsed_args.templates: plan_management.create_plan_from_templates( clients, name, parsed_args.templates) else: plan_management.create_default_plan( clients, container=name, queue_name=str(uuid.uuid4()))

commit_message:
Update plan files when re-deploying

When doing a second deploy we need to update the plan templates to match those
passed into the deploy command. The cleanest way to do this is to remove the
existing files in swift and then upload the new files.

Closes-Bug: #1620932
Depends-On: I35be5ed5062bb26ca31b55d049780a1423c2ce46
Change-Id: I7620c09005ee35bdb2fff1c77471548bb56baff7
(cherry picked from commit 943f5504158980853e636bec2c39879f8644f46e)

commit_message:
Get template contents from plan, not local path

This allows the new overcloud.j2.yaml format, which is
rendered to create the overcloud.yaml file in the swift
plan via the tripleo.process_templates action

Note it may be valid to modify the roles_data prior to an update,
so we need a plan update workflow that can re-run the process_templates
step.

Partially-Implements: blueprint custom-roles
Depends-On: Iff88d1a74cf608885eed92077f85accabf1e672e
Depends-On: Ib76f028f06edf7dd44a4aadc7d3489b1c413cf57
Change-Id: I81239991f36ed5f6453184bf9cffe930832cb68b
(cherry picked from commit 2898e7595f5df5ad9e46a137a8fd5ca6bf166369)

deleted_lines: self.log.debug("Getting template contents") template_path) objectclient = clients.tripleoclient.object_store except six.moves.urllib.error.URLError as e: messages.append(str(e.reason))
